{"step_by_step_thinking": "Fishman's Skeletal Maturation Index is a method used to assess the stages of bone maturation. It uses hand and wrist radiographs to evaluate the maturation of specific bones. The number of sites examined in this method is 4, which includes the middle phalanx of the third finger (MP3), the radius, the ulna, and the sesamoid bone of the thumb.", "answer_choice": "A"}
